{{also|junge}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Jung}} {{qualifier|colloquial, regional}} ===Etymology=== Nominalisation of {{m|gmh|jung||young}}. Already occasionally in {{etyl|gmh|de}}, later fully nominalised with the invariable nominative ''ein Junge'' (instead of ''ein'' {{m|de|Junger}}). The recognition as the normal standard term for “boy” is based on [[Central German|Central]] and [[Low German]] usage and has only fully asserted itself during the 20th century (compare {{m|de|Knabe}}). The now quite common plural form ''Jungs (Jungens)'' is also from {{etyl|nds-de|de}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|young}} {{qual|n.}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈjʊŋə/}} * {{audio|de|De-Junge.ogg|audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Jungen|Jungen|pl2=Jungs|pl3=Jungens|Jünglein|dim2=Jüngelchen|dim3=Jüngchen}} # [[boy]] # {{lb|de|card games}} [[jack]] ====Usage notes==== * The normal plural in writing is '''''Jungen''''', although the colloquial ''Jungs'' is also sometimes seen. * The third plural ''Jungens'' is not all too frequent and chiefly restricted to northern and (parts of) central Germany. * Even with the irregular plurals (''Jungs, Jungens'') the singular declension is always weak (thus with ''-n'' in the [[oblique case]]s of the singular). ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|n|n}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|Bub}}, {{l|de|Bube|g=m}} {{qualifier|southern Germany, Switzerland and Austria}} * {{l|de|Bursche|g=m}} * {{l|de|Knabe|g=m}} ====Antonyms==== * (by gender) {{l|de|Mädchen}} {{g|n}}, {{l|de|Mädel}} {{g|n}} * (by age) {{l|de|Mann}} {{g|m}} ====Hyponyms==== * {{l|de|Judenjunge}} * {{l|de|Negerjunge}} ===Noun=== {{head|de|noun form}} # {{inflection of|de|Junges||str|nom//acc|p|;|wk|nom//acc|s}} ===Related terms=== * {{l|de|jung}} * {{l|de|Jüngling}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Children]] ---- ==German Low German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|nds-de|Jung}} * {{l|nds-de|junge}} {{q|uncommon}} ===Noun=== {{head|nds-de|noun|g=m}} # [[boy]] ====Inflection==== {{rfinfl|nds-de|noun|South- or Southeastwestphalian}}
